bibl.title: Simonides and Horace.
bibl.note: Our knowledge of the intertextual relationship of Simonides and Horace is increased by the publication of the new Simonidean fragments. - Introduction: History of the Issue. - Simonides at Rome: Memory Man, Man of Sorrow. - Naval Echoes: Salamis and Artemisium. - The Islands of the Blest: Escape, Symposium, Closure? - Conclusion.

bibl.title: The New Simonides. Contexts of Praise and Desire

bibl.seg: Deborah BOEDEKER and David SIDER (Edd.), The New Simonides. Contexts of Praise and Desire (Oxford, 2001) pp. 261-271.

Our knowledge of the intertextual relationship of Simonides and Horace is increased by the publication of the new Simonidean fragments. - Introduction: History of the Issue. - Simonides at Rome: Memory Man, Man of Sorrow. - Naval Echoes: Salamis and Artemisium. - The Islands of the Blest: Escape, Symposium, Closure? - Conclusion.
